column4: anybody else have probs installing to an sata drive? installs fine but upon reboot says error loading os
single or dual drives
what version of ubuntu? sorry...a bit distracted here
it installs fine on my other pc. botha re identical aside from one has ide hdd and other is sata
you still around?
Yes, sorry.. wrestling a problem PC for a neighbor
Was that a laptop you were trying to install Ubuntu on?
Give me a minute to read up on your hardware..
k
you are trying to install 64 bit right...
I found a page that might help...  Your making partitions over 100 gig right?    http://ubuntuforums.org/archive/index.php/t-78387.html
i tried a 70gig main partion and a 1 gig swap. was gonna use the rest for later use if i needed it

I googled this  and came up with some interesting info  ubuntu ATI Radeon Xpress 200 sata     I used info on your system from here  http://h10025.www1.hp.com/ewfrf/wc/genericDocument?lc=en&cc=us&docname=c00572527&dlc=en&printable=no&encodeUrl=true&

ty for them links. however it doesnt mention my problem. ubuntu installs fine. sees my sata and partitions it fine. when i reboot it says error loading os. it shows this directly after the bios is done loading
It seems like lots of people have some sort of problem with that board..
Is there an option in the bios on how it handles sata...  some can make them appear as ide.
is it normal to have the hd partitioned with logical partitions as apposed to primary?
dosent matter, I normally have both..
Sorry but I am on the run tonight... good luck...

ahh ok. well anyways thats why i had the boot problem. it was partitioning / and swap both as logical. i repartitioned / as primary and it worked. it just seemed strange that it did them both as logical thats why i asked
pricy? my sata dvd burner was only like 50 bucks
